means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 特劳特职业名称，渔夫，或绰号，象鲑鱼的人，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“鲑鱼”(trout)

sentence.Network_en: Shall we have trout for dinner?
Thousands of young salmon and trout have been killed by the pollution.
sentence.Network_cn: 成千上万的鲑鱼和鳟鱼的鱼苗因污染而死亡.

sentence.Network_en: It is no use fishing for trout in this river, there are none left.
sentence.Network_cn: 这条河里捕不到鲑鱼了, 连一条也没有了.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)an annoying or bad-tempered old person, especially a woman

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English truht, from late Latin tructa, based on Greek trōgein 'gnaw'

entry.def: A trout is a fairly large fish that lives in rivers and streams.

means.word_mean: 1. flesh of any of several primarily freshwater game and food fishes
2. any of various game and food fishes of cool fresh waters mostly smaller than typical salmons
